article.description: Hubert Davis scored 19 points to lead five players in double figures as the Washington Wizards extended their winning streak to eight games with a 93-75 victory over Orlando.
article.headline: Wizards win eighth straight but lose Hamilton

images.name: Jordan, Michael 011221 inline
images.caption: Michael Jordan connected on only three of 16 shots.

article.linkText: MJ's poor shooting, Hamilton injury can't stop Wizards' win streak
article.story:
ORLANDO, Fla. (AP) -- Michael Jordan couldn't carry the load, and Richard Hamilton was hurt. It was going to take a team effort in the fourth quarter to give the Washington Wizards their eighth straight win -- and they got it. Hubert Davis scored 19, and Popeye Jones added 13 points and a season-high 14 rebounds as Washington defeated the shorthanded Orlando Magic 93-75 Friday night. Washington last had an eight-game winning streak late in the 1982-83 season. "This is probably the most impressive of the eight," said Jordan, who scored 12 points but shot just 3-for-16 from the field. "Guys really stepped up when Rip (Hamilton) went down." Jordan had five of his game-high eight assists in the final quarter, when Davis and Tyronn Lue helped Washington pull away from a 64-all tie. "The other guys started to step forward and I started to see that they had the confidence," Jordan said. "So, I fell in line. I'm not too old to learn." Davis, who had nine points in the final 10 minutes, credited the win to sharp passing and playmaking. "We're hitting the open man, we're making penetration and we're hitting the guy in rhythm," said Davis, who was averaging 6.9 points. "Guys are knocking them down. It looks really nice." But the Wizards may have lost the player most responsible for the winning streak, as Hamilton pulled his right groin in the first quarter and didn't return. Hamilton, averaging 20.3 points, had eight points in eight minutes. Washington coach Doug Collins said Hamilton is day-to-day. Jordan admitted that when Hamilton went down, he thought about taking over the game. "I felt panic in the sense of just trying to pick up his load and do a little bit more and not relying upon the young guys and letting them see if they could pick it up," he said. Mike Miller's 14 points led Orlando, which had a season-low in points. Troy Hudson and Darrell Armstrong each added 13. Tracy McGrady, the league's fifth-leading scorer, missed his second straight game with a strained lower back. Also, Miller sat most of the second half after a rough opening quarter. He banged knees with Hamilton and was flattened by Jones' flagrant foul a little more than a minute later. "At halftime, (my back) just tightened up," Miller said. "The second half, I was a liability but I didn't want to come out." Orlando's lack of offense was its downfall in the fourth quarter. The Magic missed 12 of 13 shots during one stretch and shot 27 percent for the period. That allowed Washington to go on a 16-5 run to take an 11-point lead. Chris Whitney's 3-pointer put the Wizards ahead 80-69 with 4:11 remaining. In the fourth quarter, Washington hit sank five of nine 3-point tries, with Lue hitting three shots from behind the arc. Lue and Whitney each finished with 11 points.

Game notes
Jordan's previous game in Orlando was March 25, 1998. His Chicago Bulls won 85-70, with Jordan scoring 17 points. ... Magic coach Doc Rivers said McGrady would probably return to action next Wednesday, when the Orlando hosts Indiana. McGrady has been in Atlanta since Monday for therapy on his back. ... Orlando is 10-2 when its opponent scores less than 100 points. ... Patrick Ewing's first-period baseline jumper moved him into 10th place on the career field goals list with 9,615. ... As is typical for an NBA team when Jordan visits, the game was a sellout. It was Orlando's second full house of the season.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
